question.title: Scala on Android with IntelliJ Idea ClassNotFoundException

node.contents: I tried using sbt and maven for android-scala and I quite like maven for doing the whole release thing(ProGuard-ing the scala standar lib etc). But I want lightweight recompile cycle for development inside my IDE - IntelliJ IDEA.

astNode.text: I tried using sbt and maven for android-scala and I quite like maven for doing the whole release thing(ProGuard-ing the scala standar lib etc). But I want lightweight recompile cycle for development inside my IDE - IntelliJ IDEA.

node.contents: The problem is scala files wont't compile. I configured my project like this:

astNode.text: The problem is scala files wont't compile. I configured my project like this:

node.contents:
• created android project
  • added scala facet
  • set scala compiler to global
  • added dependency on scala library(global) and set it to "provided"

astNode.text:
• created android project
  • added scala facet
  • set scala compiler to global
  • added dependency on scala library(global) and set it to "provided"

node.contents: I added a scala object and referenced it from java Activity. ClassNotFoundException and force close. It compiles cleanly(and quite quckly).

astNode.text: I added a scala object and referenced it from java Activity. ClassNotFoundException and force close. It compiles cleanly(and quite quckly).

node.contents: I created a plain old java project the same way and using same global libraries and it worked. An inspection of the apk revealed it contained scala source(!) file. So apparently it didn't event try to compile.

astNode.text: I created a plain old java project the same way and using same global libraries and it worked. An inspection of the apk revealed it contained scala source(!) file. So apparently it didn't event try to compile.

node.contents: Oh, and my phone has scala preinstalled with scala installer from play store.

astNode.text: Oh, and my phone has scala preinstalled with scala installer from play store.

node.contents: I use IntelliJ IDEA 11 community. I first tried this a few months ago and it worked.

astNode.text: I use IntelliJ IDEA 11 community. I first tried this a few months ago and it worked.

node.contents: update it works on a different machine.

astNode.text: update it works on a different machine.

node.contents: i have proguard disabled since this is a debug build and I don't need I - scala library doesn't go through dex.

astNode.text: i have proguard disabled since this is a debug build and I don't need I - scala library doesn't go through dex.

node.contents: You might have to fiddle with your "proguard.cfg" file.

astNode.text: You might have to fiddle with your "proguard.cfg" file.

node.contents: Here's the one I use from a project using Scala 2.10 and Android with the IntelliJ IDE (change the first option to match your package name):

astNode.text: Here's the one I use from a project using Scala 2.10 and Android with the IntelliJ IDE (change the first option to match your package name):

fragments.text:
##
## Keep classes of named package
##
-keep public class **.keithpinson.**
## ## ## ## ## ## ## ## ## ## ## ## ##


##
## RELEASE ONLY
##
##-optimizationpasses 3
##-overloadaggressively
##-repackageclasses ''
##-allowaccessmodification
##-optimizations !code/simplification/arithmetic
##         ,!field/*,!class/merging/*,!code/allocation/variable
##-keepattributes *Annotation*

##
## DEBUG ONLY
##
-dontobfuscate
-dontoptimize
-keepattributes Exceptions,

## -printmapping mapping.txt


##
## ALL VERSIONS
##
-dontpreverify
-dontskipnonpubliclibraryclasses
-dontskipnonpubliclibraryclassmembers
-dontusemixedcaseclassnames


## Keep Limited Serializable Capability
##-keepclassmembers class * implements

node.contents: Seems idea will use the system proguard configuration to optimize the jar when uncheck the Run ProGuard on Android facet, simple uncheck it seems don't work, so you need use some customized config for proguard, just try this, it work for me, please replace REPLACE WITH YOUR PACKAGE with you package

astNode.text: Seems idea will use the system proguard configuration to optimize the jar when uncheck the Run ProGuard on Android facet, simple uncheck it seems don't work, so you need use some customized config for proguard, just try this, it work for me, please replace REPLACE WITH YOUR PACKAGE with you package

node.contents: Of course, you may try Keith's config.

astNode.text: Of course, you may try Keith's config.

elements.contents:
-dontobfuscate
-dontoptimize
-dontpreverify

-dontskipnonpubliclibraryclasses
-dontskipnonpubliclibraryclassmembers

-dontwarn

#scala.Enumeration accesses a field 'MODULE$' dynamically
-dontnote scala.Enumeration

#(org.xml.sax.EntityResolver)Class.forName(variable).newInstance()
-dontnote org.xml.sax.EntityResolver

#(org.apache.james.mime4j.storage.StorageProvider)Class.forName(variable).newInstance()
-dontnote org.apache.james.mime4j.storage.DefaultStorageProvider

-keepattributes Exceptions,InnerClasses,Signature,Deprecated,
            SourceFile,LineNumberTable,Annotation,EnclosingMethod

-keep public class REPLACE WITH YOUR PACKAGE
